div.p: ROTA the nameol an ecclefiaſtical court of Rome, compoſed of 12 prelates, of whom one muſt be a Gelman, another a Frenchman, and two Spaniards ; the other eight are Italians, three of whom muſt be Romans, and the other five a Bologneſe, a Ferraran, a Milaneſe, a Venetian, and a Tuſcan.—This is one of
the moſt auguſt tribunals m Rome, wr∣ιch takes cognizance oſ all ſuits in the territory of the church, by appeal; as alſo of all matters, beneficiary and patrimonial.
